Subsection.Text: When a lawful arrest is effected, a peace officer may search the person arrested and the area within the person’s immediate presence for the purpose of:

Paragraph.Text: Preventing the person from escaping; or
Discovering the fruits of a crime.

Subsection.Text: A peace officer making a lawful search without a warrant may seize all instruments, articles, or things discovered on the person arrested or within the person’s immediate control, the seizure of which is reasonably necessary for the purpose of:

Paragraph.Text: Preventing the escape of the arrested person; or
Assuring subsequent lawful custody of the fruits of a crime or of the articles used in the commission of a crime.
